item.title: Quarterly Earnings Review: Dec-2025 Results Show Mixed Trends Across Market Caps
item.description: The December 2025 quarter earnings season has revealed a nuanced picture across Indian equities, with 1687 companies reporting results. While the overall proportion of positive earnings surprises has improved marginally to 46.0%, the distribution across market capitalisation segments and sectors highlights divergent performance trends that investors should carefully consider. Time: 7 minutes ago

item.title: Petronet LNG Gains 2.33%: Mixed Technical and Valuation Signals Shape Weekly Performance
item.description: Petronet LNG Ltd. recorded a 2.33% gain over the week ending 6 February 2026, outperforming the Sensex’s 1.51% rise. The stock showed resilience amid mixed technical momentum and a shift in valuation perception, closing at Rs.296.15 on Friday after a week of moderate gains and cautious investor sentiment. Key events included a sideways technical trend emerging midweek and a valuation grade downgrade reflecting evolving sector dynamics. Time: 43 minutes ago

item.title: Ganesh Housing Falls 2.15% Amid 52-Week Low and Revenue Drop: 3 Key Factors Driving the Decline
item.description: Ganesh Housing Corporation Ltd’s stock closed the week at Rs.713.80, down 2.15% from Rs.729.45, underperforming the Sensex which gained 1.51% over the same period. The week was marked by a sharp decline culminating in a 52-week low on 6 February 2026, driven by disappointing quarterly results and sustained selling pressure despite intermittent gains earlier in the week. Time: 43 minutes ago

item.title: Dredging Corporation of India Ltd Falls 12.73%: 3 Key Factors Driving the Weekly Decline
item.description: Dredging Corporation of India Ltd experienced a challenging week, with its stock price declining by 12.73% from Rs.1,127.90 to Rs.984.30, sharply underperforming the Sensex which gained 1.51% over the same period. The week was marked by significant intraday volatility, a deepening loss in Q3 FY26 results, and a notable shift in valuation metrics signalling changing market sentiment. Time: 44 minutes ago

item.title: Jindal Steel Ltd Gains 5.22%: 5 Key Factors Driving the Surge
item.description: Jindal Steel Ltd. delivered a strong weekly performance, gaining 5.22% from Rs.1,130.70 to Rs.1,189.75 between 2 and 6 February 2026, significantly outperforming the Sensex’s 1.51% rise over the same period. The stock demonstrated consistent upward momentum, hitting multiple new 52-week and all-time highs amid improving technical indicators and robust market positioning within the ferrous metals sector. Time: 44 minutes ago

item.title: Gufic BioSciences Gains 1.27%: 2 Key Factors Driving the Weekly Move
item.description: Gufic BioSciences Ltd closed the week with a modest gain of 1.27%, rising from Rs.306.05 on 30 January 2026 to Rs.309.95 on 6 February 2026. This performance slightly lagged the broader Sensex, which advanced 1.51% over the same period. The week was marked by a sharp recovery following a fresh 52-week low on 2 February, driven by a strong gap up on 3 February amid positive sector momentum, though technical challenges and bearish longer-term indicators persisted. Time: 44 minutes ago

item.title: James Warren Tea Ltd. Declines 2.50% Amid Downgrade and Q3 Loss
item.description: James Warren Tea Ltd. closed the week down 2.50% at Rs.321.30, underperforming the Sensex which rose 1.51%. The week was marked by a significant downgrade to a Sell rating amid technical weakness and flat financials, followed by a quarterly loss announcement reflecting seasonal pressures. Despite midweek gains, the stock struggled to maintain momentum against a broadly positive market backdrop. Time: 44 minutes ago

item.title: Ajmera Realty & Infra India Ltd Drops 4.22%: 4 Key Factors Behind the Weekly Slide
item.description: Ajmera Realty & Infra India Ltd’s stock declined by 4.22% over the week ending 6 February 2026, closing at Rs.145.40 from Rs.151.80 the previous Friday. This underperformance contrasts with the Sensex’s 1.51% gain during the same period, reflecting persistent bearish momentum and technical challenges for the small-cap realty firm amid sector headwinds and deteriorating fundamentals. Time: 44 minutes ago

item.title: Transformers & Rectifiers India Ltd Gains 5.06%: 4 Key Factors Driving the Week

item.title: State Bank of India Dips 1.03% Despite New Highs: 5 Key Factors Driving the Week
item.description: State Bank of India (SBI) experienced a volatile week from 2 to 6 February 2026, closing marginally lower by 1.03% at Rs.1,066.40 despite a strong midweek rally that saw the stock hit a new 52-week and all-time high of Rs.1,090. The broader Sensex outperformed with a 1.51% gain over the same period, highlighting a divergence between SBI’s price action and the market benchmark. This review analyses the key events and price movements shaping SBI’s performance during the week. Time: 44 minutes ago

item.title: Poonawalla Fincorp Gains 8.26%: 4 Key Factors Driving the Week’s Momentum
item.description: Poonawalla Fincorp Ltd delivered a robust weekly performance, rising 8.26% from Rs.398.50 to Rs.431.40 between 2 and 6 February 2026, significantly outperforming the Sensex’s 1.51% gain over the same period. item.title: DLF Ltd Gains 4.46%: Key Drivers Behind This Week’s Rally
item.description: DLF Ltd. delivered a solid weekly performance, rising 4.46% from Rs.635.20 to Rs.663.55 between 2 and 6 February 2026, comfortably outperforming the Sensex’s 1.51% gain over the same period. The stock’s rebound was driven primarily by a strong gap-up opening and intraday surge on 3 February, reflecting renewed investor interest amid a volatile market backdrop. Despite mixed technical signals and a cautious rating outlook, DLF demonstrated resilience within the real estate sector, supported by sector-wide gains and improving momentum. Time: 45 minutes ago

item.title: Astral Ltd’s Mildly Bullish Shift: 2.91% Weekly Gain Amid Mixed Signals
item.description: Astral Ltd experienced a modestly negative week with its share price declining by 0.26% to close at ₹1,472.75 on 6 Feb 2026, underperforming the Sensex which gained 1.51% over the same period. The week was marked by significant technical momentum shifts, a key earnings release, and an upgrade in analyst rating from Sell to Hold by MarketsMOJO, reflecting a nuanced market sentiment amid mixed signals. Time: 45 minutes ago

item.title: AXISCADES Technologies Ltd Drops 8.73%: 5 Key Factors Behind the Volatile Week
item.description: AXISCADES Technologies Ltd experienced a turbulent week from 2 to 6 February 2026, with its stock price declining sharply by 8.73% to close at ₹1,122.30, while the Sensex gained 1.51%. The week was marked by extreme volatility, including two lower circuit hits and multiple upper circuit surges, reflecting intense swings in investor sentiment amid mixed technical signals and shifting analyst ratings. item.title: Cosmo First Ltd Gains 3.47%: Key Factors Behind This Week’s Volatility
item.description: Cosmo First Ltd closed the week with a 3.47% gain, outperforming the Sensex’s 1.51% rise over the same period from 2 to 6 February 2026. The stock’s performance was marked by a sharp rebound on 3 February, driven by a strong gap-up opening and intraday surge, followed by moderate corrections in the subsequent sessions. item.title: U. Y. Fincorp Ltd Gains 16.94%: 4 Key Factors Driving the Surge
item.description: U. Y. Fincorp Ltd delivered a remarkable weekly performance, surging 16.94% from Rs.12.40 to Rs.14.50 between 2 and 6 February 2026, significantly outperforming the Sensex’s modest 1.51% gain. item.title: Winsome Yarns Ltd Falls 4.09%: 4 Key Events Shaping This Week’s Decline

item.title: Tanla Platforms Ltd Falls 7.10%: Technical Downgrade and Growth Concerns Weigh

item.title: National Aluminium Company Ltd Falls 7.86%: Volatility and Institutional Interest Mark the Week
item.description: National Aluminium Company Ltd (NATIONALUM) experienced a challenging week from 2 to 6 February 2026, with its stock price declining by 7.86% to close at Rs.354.45, underperforming the Sensex which gained 1.51% over the same period.
